back_cards.definition_en: Specifies a particular noun known in context.
back_cards.example_en: The cat slept on the windowsill.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a unique or specific entity.
back_cards.example_en: The moon glowed brightly last night.

back_cards.definition_en: Denotes a general class or group.
back_cards.example_en: The elephant is a gentle giant.
She’s the fastest runner in school.
He bought a phone, and the phone was new.
There is a bird in the tree.
He will be manager next month.
I am tired after work.
They are studying for the test.
This is my best friend.
I ate pizza and salad for dinner.
She sang and danced at the party.
He worked and then relaxed.
It snowed, and school closed.
The house was big and bright.
A dog ran across the yard.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to one of many items.
back_cards.example_en: I need a pen for the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Mentions something for the first time.
back_cards.example_en: She told a joke at the party.
He’s a doctor at the hospital.
It costs a dollar per apple.
The keys of the car are lost.
The wine of Tuscany is famous.
A piece of pie is left.
The ring is made of gold.
She cried of joy at the news.
I walked to the store today.
She studies to become a lawyer.
I gave a book to my sister.
The shop is open to midnight.
The score was two to one.
The book is in the bag.
We met in June last year.
He’s in a good mood today.
She works in marketing.
They paid in cash.
I love to read at night.
I think the plan will work.
I baked cookies yesterday.
I saw a rainbow this morning.
I will call you tomorrow.
You seem happy today.
You should eat healthy food.
You turn right at the light.
You know how fun summer is.
You all are welcome here.
I dropped the cup, and it broke.
It’s sunny this afternoon.
It feels nice to relax.
The cat jumped, and it landed.
It was a great concert.
I have a new laptop.
She had fun at the park.
They have lunch at noon.
You have to be on time.
He had his hair cut.
We went to the beach.
He trains to win the race.
She sent a card to her mom.
It’s ten minutes to eight.
This key is to the safe.
That chair is broken.
The dog that barked was loud.
He said that he was late.
It’s not that far to walk.
She ran so fast that she won.
I got a gift for you.
He stayed for two hours.
This cake is for the team.
I’m for the new rule.
She was fined for speeding.
I do yoga every morning.
What do you do at work?
I do want to go hiking.
She did the dishes.
He does well in school.
He bought a new jacket.
He is the team captain.
He climbed the tall mountain.
The horse galloped, and he neighed.
He says the movie was great.
I went with my brother.
She wrote with a pencil.
The car with the dent is mine.
He spoke with enthusiasm.
She shivered with cold.
The cup is on the desk.
The meeting is on Friday.
He wrote a book on history.
She lives on her savings.
The TV is on now.
This table is wobbly.
This month is very busy.
This problem needs solving.
This woman helped me.
This happened last week.
I don’t like spicy food.
She isn’t at home now.
They aren’t coming today.
He didn’t finish the task.
It wasn’t that difficult.
